snippet: Townsend Farms of Oregon said a frozen berry blend sold in Costco and Harris Teeter stores had been linked to a seven-state outbreak.
abstract: Townsend Farms of Oregon announces voluntary recall of frozen blend of organic berries after Centers for Disease Control linked it to multistate outbreak of hepatitis A; berry blend sold in Costco and Harris Teeter stores includes pomegranate seeds from Turkey, which company says might be source of virus that has affected 49 people in Arizona, California, Colorado, Hawaii, Nevada, New Mexico and Utah.
lead_paragraph: Townsend Farms of Oregon said a frozen berry blend sold in Costco and Harris Teeter stores had been linked to a seven-state outbreak.

headline.seo: Hepatitis Warning Leads to a Berry Recall
headline.main: Hepatitis Warning Leads to Recall of Frozen Berries
headline.print_headline: Hepatitis Warning Leads To Recall of Frozen Berries
